reviews.review:
I guess you could say this game is a weird combination of a top tier competitive FPS and your biggest nightmare. Admittedly, I played this game a couple of times... ok, I played it a shit ton back in 2014-2016. Then the game suddenly became the new Fortnite... or Minecraft, at least for that time, and playing it was to be considered something utterly awful. Then in 2019 I slowly started playing it more and more.

Since it is a free to play game, expect toxicity.  A lot of it. Worst thing a free to play game can have, is a community. Usually it's people who don't value the game too much, since they never paid a single cent for it, so they can scream n-words in voice chat with no issue. So if you think of starting to play CSGO, consider doing it with at least 4 homies. Your friends will save you from toxic teammates. 
Another thing to note, you won't be able to participate in competitive 5v5 mode without reaching a certain XP level, which is kinda gay, but also understandable. 
In any case, if you somehow have decided to try CSGO, make your own opinion on it. You may fall in love with it, or absolutely hate it
